thread.title: Tom Cruise 'Appears to Have Had Some Volume Restoration' Amid Plastic Surgery Rumors, Expert Says
thread.title_full: Tom Cruise 'Appears to Have Had Some Volume Restoration' Amid Plastic Surgery Rumors, Expert Says

author: Mark McGarry In Touch Weekly
title: Tom Cruise 'Appears to Have Had Some Volume Restoration' Amid Plastic Surgery Rumors, Expert Says
text:
Celebrities
Tom Cruise ‘Appears to Have Had Some Volume Restoration’ Amid Plastic Surgery Rumors, Expert Says
There's a huge buzz surrounding
Tom Cruise's dramatic Super Bowl intro - but for all the wrong reasons. Online critics say the 63-year-old Top Gun: Maverick star's face looked "puffy" and "stretched," sparking plastic surgery rumors. (The actor has never admitted to getting work done.) "He appears to have had some volume restoration, likely through fat grafting or possibly using expertly placed dermal fillers," Dr. Renata Khelemsky, a double board-certified and fellowship-trained facial cosmetic surgeon, who has not treated the actor, exclusively tells In Touch.
"In Tom's case, this appears to have made a
significant change in the midface, cheeks and under-eye areas, restoring a fuller look. The results are striking because we're seeing the contrast between his newly volumized features and older photos where volume loss was more pronounced." If Tom did get some pre-Super Bowl tweaks, the work was good overall, says Dr. Khelemsky: "He appears refreshed and more youthful, reflecting a strategic, staged approach to facial rejuvenation."

This story was originally published February 20, 2025 at 4:12 PM.
